action.action-desc: Mr. Panetta (for himself, Mr. Cárdenas, Ms. Eshoo, Mr. Mullin, and Mr. Sherman) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To provide for certain requirements of the Federal Aviation Administration in response to requests for information by Congress, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Responsive Employees Support Productive Educated Congressional Talk Act or the RESPECT Act.

subsection.text: This section is enacted pursuant to the legislative oversight responsibilities of Congress and to enable a Member of Congress to effectively represent their constituents and respond to constituent inquiries.

If a Member of Congress submits to the FAA a written request for information on proposed, previous, or current flight procedures or other data or information relating to the District of such Member, the following conditions apply:

paragraph.text: Not later than 90 days after receipt of such request, the Administrator of the FAA shall substantively respond in writing with the requested data or information in the format requested by the Member of Congress, if—

subparagraph.text: the data is within the control of the FAA; and
the data would be otherwise appropriate to provide if requested—

clause.text: by an airline, an airport, a flight procedure proponent, an Aviation Roundtable, or anyone not employed by the FAA; or
via a Freedom of Information request from any individual or any entity.

paragraph.text: If the Administrator does not provide the requested information pursuant to paragraph (1), the Administrator shall notify the requesting Member of Congress, Congress, and the Chairman and Ranking Member of the Transportation and Infrastructure Committee of the House of Representatives.

subsection.text: If a Member of Congress submits to the FAA a written request for the FAA to provide staff at a private or public meeting with the Member, the Administrator shall provide such staff if—

paragraph.text: the request is made in writing at least 30 days before the meeting date; and
the request is made on the same terms and conditions as specified by FAA appearances at Aviation Roundtable meetings.

subsection.text: If the Administrator does not comply with a request made by a Member of Congress (as described in subsection (c)), the Administrator shall provide the requesting Member of Congress, Congress, and the Chairman and Ranking Member of the Transportation and Infrastructure Committee of the House of Representatives with an explanation why the request will not be fulfilled.
In this section, the following definitions apply:

paragraph.text: The term flight procedure means a preplanned Instrument Flight Rules (IFR) procedure published for pilot use, in graphic or textual format, that provides obstruction clearance from the terminal area to the en route structure (departure) or from the en route structure to the terminal area (arrival).
The term procedure proponent means a person or entity proposing a new or modified flight procedure.
The term Aviation Roundtable means an organization designed to address community concerns over a sustained period of time regarding aircraft operations often associated with a nearby airport.
